tasks.title: Set up Next.js 15.4.4 project with TypeScript and React 18
tasks.description: Initialize the project with Next.js 15.4.4, React 18, and TypeScript as specified in the technical architecture requirements.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project using `npx create-next-app@latest lotplanner-ipad-pro`
2. Configure TypeScript support
3. Set up project structure following best practices for iPad-optimized web apps
4. Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality
5. Set up Git repository with appropriate .gitignore
6. Install core dependencies:
   - React 18
   - TypeScript
   - Next.js 15.4.4
7. Configure build scripts for development and production
8. Set up environment variables for different environments
9. Create initial documentation for project setup
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify successful project initialization with `npm run dev`
2. Confirm TypeScript compilation works without errors
3. Validate ESLint and Prettier configurations
4. Test build process with `npm run build`
5. Ensure project runs correctly in iPad Safari browser

subtasks.title: Initialize Next.js project with create-next-app
subtasks.description: Create a new Next.js 15.4.4 project with TypeScript and React 18 using the create-next-app command.
subtasks.details:
Run `npx create-next-app@latest lotplanner-ipad-pro` and select the following options during setup:
- Would you like to use TypeScript? Yes
- Would you like to use ESLint? Yes
- Would you like to use Tailwind CSS? Yes
- Would you like to use `src/` directory? Yes
- Would you like to use App Router? Yes
- Would you like to customize the default import alias? No
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the project initializes successfully by running `npm run dev` and checking that the development server starts without errors.

subtasks.title: Configure project structure for iPad-optimized web app
subtasks.description: Set up the project directory structure following best practices for iPad-optimized web applications.
subtasks.details:
Create the following directory structure:
- src/app: Main application routes
- src/components: Reusable UI components
- src/hooks: Custom React hooks
- src/utils: Utility functions
- src/types: TypeScript type definitions
- src/styles: Global styles and theme configuration
- src/lib: Third-party library integrations
- src/constants: Application constants
- public/icons: App icons for PWA support

Create placeholder index files in each directory to maintain structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all directories are created correctly and the project structure follows the defined pattern.

subtasks.title: Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality
subtasks.description: Set up and configure ESLint and Prettier with rules optimized for TypeScript and React development.
subtasks.details:
1. Install additional ESLint and Prettier dependencies:
```
npm install --save-dev prettier eslint-config-prettier eslint-plugin-prettier @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin @typescript-eslint/parser
```

2. Create `.prettierrc.js` with configuration:
```
module.exports = {
  semi: true,
  trailingComma: 'all',
  singleQuote: true,
  printWidth: 100,
  tabWidth: 2,
};
```

3. Update `.eslintrc.json` to extend prettier and add TypeScript rules

4. Create `.vscode/settings.json` for editor integration
subtasks.testStrategy: Run ESLint and Prettier on the codebase to verify there are no configuration errors and code formatting works as expected.

subtasks.title: Set up Git repository with appropriate .gitignore
subtasks.description: Initialize Git repository and configure .gitignore file with appropriate rules for Next.js, TypeScript, and development environments.
subtasks.details:
1. Initialize Git repository:
```
git init
```

2. Update .gitignore to include:
- Node modules: `node_modules/`
- Build outputs: `.next/`, `out/`
- Environment files: `.env*.local`
- Debug logs: `npm-debug.log*`
- IDE specific files: `.vscode/` (except settings.json), `.idea/`
- OS specific files: `.DS_Store`, `Thumbs.db`

3. Create initial commit:
```
git add .
git commit -m "Initial project setup with Next.js 15.4.4, React 18, and TypeScript"
```
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify .gitignore is working correctly by ensuring excluded files are not tracked by Git.

subtasks.title: Configure environment variables for different environments
subtasks.description: Set up environment variable configuration for development, testing, and production environments.
subtasks.details:
1. Create the following environment files:
- `.env.example` (template with keys but no values)
- `.env.local` (for local development)
- `.env.test` (for testing environment)
- `.env.production` (for production builds)

2. Add the following variables to each file:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_ENV=development|test|production
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=
NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_VERSION=0.1.0
```

3. Create a `src/utils/env.ts` utility to safely access environment variables with type checking
subtasks.testStrategy: Test environment variable loading in different environments by running the app with different .env files and verifying the correct variables are loaded.

subtasks.title: Configure build scripts for development and production
subtasks.description: Set up and customize npm scripts for development, building, testing, and deployment.
subtasks.details:
Update package.json scripts section to include:
```json
"scripts": {
  "dev": "next dev",
  "build": "next build",
  "start": "next start",
  "lint": "next lint",
  "format": "prettier --write 'src/**/*.{ts,tsx}'",
  "type-check": "tsc --noEmit",
  "validate": "npm run lint && npm run type-check",
  "analyze": "ANALYZE=true next build"
}
```

Install required dependencies:
```
npm install --save-dev @next/bundle-analyzer cross-env
```

Create next.config.js with bundle analyzer configuration for optimizing bundle size.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test each script to ensure it runs without errors. Verify the build process creates optimized production assets.

subtasks.title: Configure iPad-specific viewport and PWA settings
subtasks.description: Set up viewport settings, web app manifest, and initial PWA configuration optimized for iPad Pro devices.
subtasks.details:
1. Update `src/app/layout.tsx` with iPad-optimized viewport settings:
```tsx
export const metadata = {
  title: 'LotPlanner for iPad Pro',
  description: 'Lot planning application optimized for iPad Pro',
  viewport: 'width=device-width, initial-scale=1, viewport-fit=cover, user-scalable=no',
  appleMobileWebAppCapable: 'yes',
  appleMobileWebAppStatusBarStyle: 'black-translucent'
};
```

2. Create `public/manifest.json` with PWA configuration

3. Add appropriate icons in public/icons directory

4. Add meta tags for iOS web app in layout.tsx
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the application in iPad Safari browser to verify viewport settings are correctly applied and the app can be added to home screen with proper icons.

subtasks.title: Create initial documentation for project setup
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive documentation for the project setup, including installation instructions, architecture overview, and development guidelines.
subtasks.details:
Create the following documentation files:

1. `README.md` with:
   - Project overview and purpose
   - Installation instructions
   - Available scripts
   - Technology stack
   - Project structure
   - Development guidelines

2. `CONTRIBUTING.md` with:
   - Code style guidelines
   - Pull request process
   - Branch naming conventions

3. `docs/` directory with:
   - `architecture.md`: System architecture overview
   - `ipad-optimization.md`: iPad-specific optimizations
   - `environment-setup.md`: Development environment setup
subtasks.testStrategy: Review documentation for completeness and accuracy. Verify a new team member can set up the project by following the documentation.

tasks.title: Implement Tailwind CSS with iPad-specific responsive design
tasks.description: Set up Tailwind CSS and configure it with custom breakpoints and utilities optimized for iPad Pro devices.
tasks.details:
1. Install Tailwind CSS and its dependencies
2. Configure tailwind.config.js with custom breakpoints for iPad Pro 11" and 12.9" models
3. Set up custom color scheme matching iOS native colors:
   - Primary: iOS Blue (#007AFF)
   - Success: iOS Green (#34C759)
   - Warning: iOS Orange (#FF9500)
   - Error: iOS Red (#FF3B30)
4. Create utility classes for iOS-like components (buttons, inputs, etc.)
5. Configure dark mode support to match iOS dynamic colors
6. Set up responsive design utilities for different iPad orientations
7. Create typography system using SF Pro Display and SF Mono fonts
8. Implement dynamic type support for accessibility
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify custom color scheme matches iOS native colors
2. Test responsive design on different iPad Pro sizes (11" and 12.9")
3. Validate dark mode switching functionality
4. Test typography system with different font sizes
5. Verify accessibility compliance with dynamic type

subtasks.title: Install and configure Tailwind CSS with project dependencies
subtasks.description: Set up Tailwind CSS in the project by installing necessary packages and creating the initial configuration files.
subtasks.details:
1. Install Tailwind CSS and its dependencies using npm or yarn: `npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer`
2. Generate the tailwind.config.js and postcss.config.js files using the initialization command: `npx tailwindcss init -p`
3. Configure the content paths in tailwind.config.js to specify which files should be processed
4. Add the Tailwind directives to your CSS file: `@tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities;`
5. Update your build process to include Tailwind CSS processing
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify Tailwind CSS is properly installed by testing a basic utility class like 'text-blue-500' and confirming it applies the expected styling.

subtasks.title: Configure custom breakpoints for iPad Pro devices
subtasks.description: Set up custom breakpoints in the Tailwind configuration specifically optimized for iPad Pro 11" and 12.9" models in both portrait and landscape orientations.
subtasks.details:
1. Modify the tailwind.config.js file to add custom breakpoints for iPad Pro devices:
```
theme: {
  screens: {
    'ipad-11-portrait': '834px',
    'ipad-11-landscape': '1194px',
    'ipad-12-portrait': '1024px',
    'ipad-12-landscape': '1366px',
  }
}
```
2. Add orientation-specific breakpoints:
```
'portrait': {'raw': '(orientation: portrait)'},
'landscape': {'raw': '(orientation: landscape)'}
```
3. Create combined breakpoints for specific device/orientation combinations
4. Document the custom breakpoints for team reference
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the responsive breakpoints by resizing the browser to match iPad Pro dimensions and verifying that the layout responds appropriately at each breakpoint.

subtasks.title: Implement iOS native color scheme and dark mode support
subtasks.description: Create a custom color palette matching iOS native colors and implement dark mode support that dynamically adjusts to match iOS system preferences.
subtasks.details:
1. Define custom colors in tailwind.config.js to match iOS native colors:
```
colors: {
  'ios-blue': '#007AFF',
  'ios-green': '#34C759',
  'ios-orange': '#FF9500',
  'ios-red': '#FF3B30',
  // Add dark mode variants
  'ios-blue-dark': '#0A84FF',
  'ios-green-dark': '#30D158',
  'ios-orange-dark': '#FF9F0A',
  'ios-red-dark': '#FF453A'
}
```
2. Configure dark mode in tailwind.config.js: `darkMode: 'media'`
3. Create CSS variables for dynamic color switching
4. Implement a JavaScript utility to detect system dark mode changes
5. Create utility classes for applying iOS-style colors to elements
subtasks.testStrategy: Test dark mode by toggling system dark mode and verifying colors update correctly. Compare colors against iOS native UI to ensure they match in both light and dark modes.

subtasks.title: Create iOS-like component utility classes
subtasks.description: Develop a set of utility classes for common iOS UI components such as buttons, inputs, and cards that match the iOS design language.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a component showcase page displaying all iOS-style components and compare them side-by-side with native iOS components to ensure visual consistency.

subtasks.title: Implement SF Pro typography system with dynamic type
subtasks.description: Set up a typography system using SF Pro Display and SF Pro Text fonts with support for dynamic type scaling for accessibility.
subtasks.details:
1. Add SF Pro fonts to the project (ensure proper licensing):
   - SF Pro Display for headings
   - SF Pro Text for body content
   - SF Mono for code
2. Configure font families in tailwind.config.js:
```
fontFamily: {
  'sf-pro-display': ['SF Pro Display', 'system-ui', 'sans-serif'],
  'sf-pro-text': ['SF Pro Text', 'system-ui', 'sans-serif'],
  'sf-mono': ['SF Mono', 'monospace']
}
```
3. Create typography scale matching iOS dynamic type sizes
4. Implement JavaScript utility to detect and respond to system font size changes
5. Create utility classes for each dynamic type size
6. Set up responsive typography that scales appropriately on different iPad models
subtasks.testStrategy: Test typography by changing system font size settings and verifying text scales appropriately. Verify font rendering matches iOS native appearance across different text sizes.

subtasks.title: Configure responsive utilities for iPad orientations
subtasks.description: Create specialized responsive utilities for handling different iPad orientations and implement touch-friendly sizing for interactive elements.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test orientation utilities by rotating device/simulator between portrait and landscape modes. Verify touch targets are appropriately sized by testing with touch input on actual iPad devices.

tasks.title: Set up Konva.js with React-Konva for canvas rendering
tasks.description: Implement the core canvas engine using Konva.js and React-Konva for high-performance 2D rendering as specified in the technical architecture.
tasks.details:
1. Install Konva.js and React-Konva packages
2. Create a base Canvas component with proper sizing for iPad Pro
3. Implement basic canvas functionality:
   - Pan/zoom transformations
   - Layer management
   - Object rendering
4. Set up canvas state management using React Context API
5. Configure canvas for 60fps performance with 1000+ equipment items
6. Implement canvas virtualization for performance optimization
7. Set up object pooling for efficient rendering
8. Configure level-of-detail rendering based on zoom level
9. Implement ProMotion support for 120Hz refresh rate
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Measure rendering performance with Chrome DevTools
2. Test canvas with 1000+ simulated equipment items
3. Verify smooth pan/zoom operations at 60fps minimum
4. Validate memory usage remains under 2GB for large projects
5. Test on actual iPad Pro devices to verify ProMotion support

subtasks.title: Install and configure Konva.js and React-Konva packages
subtasks.description: Set up the project with Konva.js and React-Konva libraries, ensuring proper configuration for React integration.
subtasks.details: Install Konva.js and React-Konva using npm or yarn: 'npm install konva react-konva'. Create a basic project structure with appropriate folders for canvas components. Configure any necessary build tools to support these packages. Verify the installation by creating a simple test component that renders a Konva Stage.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a simple test component that renders a Konva Stage with a basic shape to verify proper installation and configuration.

subtasks.title: Create base Canvas component with iPad Pro sizing
subtasks.description: Develop a responsive Canvas component that properly sizes for iPad Pro dimensions and handles device orientation changes.
subtasks.details: Create a Canvas.jsx component that uses React-Konva's Stage and Layer components. Set up responsive sizing based on iPad Pro dimensions (12.9-inch: 2732 x 2048px, 11-inch: 2388 x 1668px). Implement orientation detection and resizing. Configure proper pixel ratio handling for Retina displays. Add touch event listeners for basic interaction. Create a container component that manages the canvas size and position.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the Canvas component on different iPad Pro sizes and orientations. Verify that the canvas properly resizes and maintains aspect ratio. Check that pixel ratio is handled correctly for crisp rendering.

subtasks.title: Implement pan and zoom transformations
subtasks.description: Add pan and zoom functionality to the canvas with smooth transformations optimized for touch interactions.
subtasks.details: Implement pan functionality using Konva's drag events or custom touch handlers. Add pinch-to-zoom using touch events with proper multi-touch support. Create transformation state (scale, position) in the component. Implement zoom limits to prevent excessive zooming in/out. Add momentum for pan operations for natural feel. Optimize touch event handling for 120Hz ProMotion displays. Implement zoom-to-point functionality so zooming centers on fingers rather than canvas center.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test pan and zoom operations for smoothness at 60fps. Verify pinch-to-zoom works naturally with multi-touch. Test edge cases like rapid zooming and panning. Measure performance impact during transformations.

subtasks.title: Set up canvas state management with React Context API
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive state management system using React Context API to handle canvas state, transformations, and selected objects.
subtasks.details: Create a CanvasContext.jsx file with React.createContext(). Implement a CanvasProvider component that wraps the application. Define state for: canvas transformations (scale, position), selected objects, active layers, and viewport information. Create actions and reducers for state modifications. Implement methods for common operations (select, transform, add/remove objects). Add performance optimizations like debouncing for frequent updates. Set up proper state persistence for undo/redo functionality.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test state updates during canvas interactions. Verify that components correctly consume context values. Check for performance issues with frequent state updates. Test that state properly persists for undo/redo operations.

subtasks.title: Implement layer management and object rendering
subtasks.description: Create a system for managing multiple canvas layers and efficiently rendering different types of objects within those layers.
subtasks.details: Implement a LayerManager class to handle multiple Konva.Layer instances. Create a hierarchy of layers (background, main, foreground, UI). Develop object factories for different equipment types. Implement z-index management for proper stacking. Add layer visibility toggling. Create object caching for performance optimization. Implement object grouping functionality. Add layer export/import capabilities. Set up event propagation between layers.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test rendering of multiple layers with various objects. Verify proper z-index handling and stacking. Test layer visibility toggling. Measure rendering performance with multiple complex layers. Verify object selection works correctly across layers.

subtasks.title: Implement performance optimizations for large-scale rendering
subtasks.description: Add advanced performance optimizations to ensure smooth 60fps rendering with 1000+ equipment items, including virtualization and object pooling.
subtasks.details: Implement canvas virtualization to only render visible objects. Create an object pooling system for efficient object reuse. Add level-of-detail rendering based on zoom level (simplified shapes when zoomed out). Implement batch updates for multiple object changes. Add frame rate throttling for consistent performance. Optimize event handling to reduce overhead. Implement WebWorker for calculations that could block the main thread. Add performance monitoring tools. Configure ProMotion support for 120Hz refresh rate on compatible devices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Benchmark rendering performance with 1000+ simulated equipment items. Measure memory usage during intensive operations. Test frame rate stability during pan/zoom with many objects. Verify that virtualization correctly handles off-screen objects. Test on actual iPad Pro devices to verify ProMotion support.

tasks.title: Implement multi-touch gesture recognition system
tasks.description: Create a comprehensive touch and gesture recognition system using react-use-gesture to support all required touch interactions.
tasks.details:
1. Install react-use-gesture package
2. Implement core gesture handlers for:
   - Single tap (select equipment or complete measurements)
   - Double tap (edit mode or detailed view)
   - Long press (context menus and precision mode)
   - Drag (move equipment and canvas panning)
   - Pinch (zoom in/out with smooth scaling)
   - Two-finger tap (undo operation)
   - Three-finger swipe (navigate between projects)
3. Create gesture state management system
4. Implement haptic feedback simulation for touch interactions
5. Add 44pt minimum touch targets following Apple HIG
6. Configure gesture conflict resolution
7. Implement magnetic snapping and object alignment
8. Add visual feedback for active gestures
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test all gesture interactions on actual iPad devices
2. Verify 44pt minimum touch targets for all interactive elements
3. Validate gesture conflict resolution works correctly
4. Test magnetic snapping and alignment functionality
5. Measure touch response time (<16ms touch-to-visual feedback)

subtasks.title: Set up react-use-gesture and basic gesture infrastructure
subtasks.description: Install the react-use-gesture package and set up the core infrastructure for gesture handling in the application.
subtasks.details: Install react-use-gesture using npm or yarn. Create a GestureProvider component that will wrap the application and provide gesture context. Set up basic gesture configuration options including debounce settings, touch action properties, and event propagation rules. Create a custom hook (useAppGestures) that will expose gesture functionality to components.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify successful installation of the package. Test that the GestureProvider renders without errors. Confirm the custom hook returns expected gesture objects.

subtasks.title: Implement basic touch gestures (tap, double-tap, long-press)
subtasks.description: Implement the core single-touch gesture handlers for tap, double-tap, and long-press interactions.
subtasks.details: Create gesture handlers for single tap (for selecting equipment or completing measurements), double tap (for entering edit mode or detailed view), and long press (for context menus and precision mode). Ensure all touch targets follow the 44pt minimum size requirement from Apple HIG. Implement timing configurations for distinguishing between taps and double-taps. Add visual feedback indicators for each gesture type.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test each gesture on actual iPad devices. Verify correct distinction between tap types. Measure response time to ensure it's under 16ms. Confirm visual feedback appears for each gesture.

subtasks.title: Implement drag and pan gestures
subtasks.description: Create handlers for drag operations to move equipment and implement canvas panning functionality.
subtasks.details: Implement drag gesture handlers with velocity tracking for smooth movement. Create separate handlers for equipment dragging and canvas panning with appropriate thresholds. Add magnetic snapping and object alignment during drag operations. Implement momentum-based panning for natural feel. Create boundary constraints to prevent objects from being dragged off-canvas. Add visual indicators during drag operations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test dragging various equipment items. Verify magnetic snapping works correctly. Test canvas panning with different velocities. Confirm boundary constraints prevent off-canvas dragging.

subtasks.title: Implement pinch and zoom gestures
subtasks.description: Create handlers for pinch gestures to enable smooth zooming functionality.
subtasks.details: Implement pinch gesture detection with proper scale factor calculations. Create smooth zoom transitions with animation. Add zoom limits to prevent excessive zooming in/out. Implement focal point zooming to zoom toward pinch center. Create level-of-detail rendering at different zoom levels. Add visual indicators for current zoom level.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test pinch zooming on actual iPad devices. Verify smooth transitions between zoom levels. Confirm zoom limits work correctly. Test focal point accuracy during zooming.

subtasks.title: Implement multi-finger gestures
subtasks.description: Create handlers for specialized multi-finger gestures including two-finger tap and three-finger swipe.
subtasks.details: Implement two-finger tap detection for undo operations. Create three-finger swipe detection for project navigation. Add rotation gesture support using two fingers. Implement proper touch identification to track multiple simultaneous touches. Create visual guides for available multi-finger gestures. Add haptic feedback simulation for multi-finger interactions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test multi-finger gestures on actual iPad devices. Verify correct detection of finger count. Test gesture recognition accuracy with different finger spacings. Confirm haptic feedback works for each gesture.

subtasks.title: Create gesture state management system
subtasks.description: Implement a comprehensive state management system to track active gestures and handle gesture conflicts.
subtasks.details: Create a gesture state store to track active gestures across the application. Implement gesture conflict resolution logic to determine which gesture takes precedence when multiple are detected. Add gesture history tracking for complex interaction sequences. Create a gesture locking mechanism to prevent unwanted gestures during certain operations. Implement gesture state persistence for maintaining state during component re-renders.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test gesture conflict scenarios to verify correct resolution. Verify gesture state persists correctly during component updates. Test gesture locking during operations that should prevent other gestures.

subtasks.title: Implement haptic feedback and visual gesture indicators
subtasks.description: Add haptic feedback simulation and visual indicators for all gesture interactions.
subtasks.details: Implement haptic feedback simulation for all gesture types with appropriate intensity levels. Create visual indicators for active gestures including touch points, drag paths, and pinch lines. Add animation effects for gesture transitions. Implement gesture success/failure indicators. Create an accessibility mode that enhances visual feedback for users with disabilities. Add sound effects option for gesture feedback.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test haptic feedback on actual iPad devices. Verify visual indicators appear for all gesture types. Test accessibility mode with screen readers. Confirm animations run smoothly during gesture transitions.

tasks.title: Create equipment data models and state management
tasks.description: Implement the data models for equipment items and canvas state as specified in the PRD, along with state management using Context API.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit test data models and state management
2. Verify state updates don't cause unnecessary re-renders
3. Test performance with large numbers of equipment items
4. Validate type safety with TypeScript compiler
5. Test state persistence and restoration

subtasks.title: Define TypeScript interfaces for equipment data models
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive TypeScript interfaces for all equipment-related data models including Equipment, EquipmentCategory, EquipmentShape, EquipmentDimensions, and EquipmentSpecs.
subtasks.details:
Create a models/equipment.ts file with the following interfaces:
- Equipment (as specified in the task)
- EquipmentCategory (enum with categories like 'ride', 'game', 'food', 'service', etc.)
- EquipmentShape (enum with shapes like 'rectangle', 'circle', 'polygon', etc.)
- EquipmentDimensions (interface with width, height, depth properties)
- EquipmentSpecs (interface with properties like power requirements, weight, capacity, etc.)

Ensure all types are properly exported and documented with JSDoc comments.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate type definitions with TypeScript compiler. Create sample objects of each type to verify structure.

subtasks.title: Implement canvas state and gesture models
subtasks.description: Define TypeScript interfaces for canvas state, transform, gestures, touch events, snap targets, and measurements.
subtasks.details:
Create a models/canvas.ts file with the following interfaces:
- CanvasState (as specified in the task)
- Transform (interface with properties for scale, translate, rotate)
- GestureType (enum with values like 'pan', 'pinch', 'rotate', etc.)
- TouchEvent (interface for tracking touch positions and timestamps)
- SnapTarget (interface defining snap points and behavior)
- Measurement (interface for storing distance/area measurements)

Ensure all interfaces are properly typed and exported.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify type definitions with TypeScript compiler. Create mock instances to validate structure.

subtasks.title: Create equipment context provider
subtasks.description: Implement a React Context provider for equipment state management that will store the equipment library and placed equipment items.
subtasks.details:
Create context/EquipmentContext.tsx with:
- EquipmentContextState interface (containing equipmentLibrary and placedEquipment)
- Initial state with empty arrays/objects
- EquipmentContext using React.createContext
- EquipmentProvider component that wraps children with the context provider
- Implement basic CRUD operations for equipment management
- Export useEquipment custom hook for consuming components
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test the provider with React Testing Library. Verify state updates correctly propagate to consumers.

subtasks.title: Implement canvas context provider
subtasks.description: Create a React Context provider for canvas state management including transform, selection, gestures, and measurements.
subtasks.details:
Create context/CanvasContext.tsx with:
- CanvasContextState interface extending the CanvasState
- Initial state with default values
- CanvasContext using React.createContext
- CanvasProvider component with state management
- Implement methods for updating transform, selection, gestures
- Create utility functions for common operations
- Export useCanvas custom hook for consuming components
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the provider with React Testing Library. Verify transform operations and selection management work correctly.

subtasks.title: Develop state reducers for equipment management
subtasks.description: Create reducer functions to handle equipment state updates in an immutable way, ensuring efficient rendering.
subtasks.details:
In reducers/equipmentReducers.ts:
- Create action types for equipment operations (ADD, UPDATE, DELETE, etc.)
- Implement reducer functions that handle each action type
- Ensure immutable state updates for React performance
- Add type safety with TypeScript for all actions and state changes
- Implement batch update capabilities for multiple operations
- Add optimized functions for common equipment manipulations
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test each reducer function with various inputs. Verify immutability of state updates.

subtasks.title: Develop state reducers for canvas operations
subtasks.description: Create reducer functions to handle canvas state updates including transform, selection, and gesture handling.
subtasks.details:
In reducers/canvasReducers.ts:
- Create action types for canvas operations (ZOOM, PAN, SELECT, etc.)
- Implement reducer functions for each action type
- Ensure all state updates are immutable
- Add performance optimizations for frequent updates (e.g., during gestures)
- Implement debouncing for continuous operations
- Create utility functions for common transform operations
- Add type safety with TypeScript
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test each reducer function. Benchmark performance with rapid state updates to ensure 60fps capability.

subtasks.title: Create custom hooks for state access and performance optimization
subtasks.description: Develop specialized custom hooks that provide optimized access to specific parts of the state to prevent unnecessary re-renders.
subtasks.details:
In hooks/stateHooks.ts:
- Create useSelectedEquipment hook that only triggers re-renders when selection changes
- Implement useEquipmentById hook for accessing specific equipment items
- Create useCanvasTransform hook for transform-only updates
- Implement useMeasurements hook for measurement operations
- Add useSnapTargets hook for snap functionality
- Create memoized selectors for derived state
- Implement performance monitoring in development mode
- Add TypeScript type safety for all hooks
subtasks.testStrategy: Test hooks in isolation and in components. Verify re-render behavior with React DevTools profiler. Ensure components only re-render when necessary.

tasks.title: Implement equipment library with drag-and-drop functionality
tasks.description: Create a touch-optimized equipment library with drag-and-drop functionality for placing items on the canvas.
tasks.details:
1. Design and implement equipment library UI with large thumbnails
2. Create category navigation system
3. Implement equipment search with predictive input
4. Set up filtering by equipment type and specifications
5. Implement drag-and-drop using React-DnD:
   - Configure drag sources for equipment items
   - Set up drop targets on canvas
   - Handle drag preview rendering
